newsitem.title: USA: U.S. will not eliminate two Army divisions - Pentagon.
newsitem.headline: U.S. will not eliminate two Army divisions - Pentagon.

text.p: The Defence Department said on Thursday it had rejected the possibility of eliminating two of the Army's 10 combat divisions as part of a major review of U.S. military strategy and forces.

"That possibility is off the table," Pentagon spokesman Ken Bacon said in response to questions on the Quadrennial Defence Review (QDR), which will be sent to Congress on May 15 by Defence Secretary William Cohen.

Published reports have said officials involved in preparing the "QDR" were looking at a proposal to get rid of 50,000 or more of the Army's 495,000 active duty troops to save money for weapons modernisation.
Its already large and diverse consumer banking and mortgage franchise should benefit from ABN AMRO's growing presence in North America.

At the same time, the thrift's operating profile should be materially enhanced by ABN AMRO's superior financial profile and the international scope of its operations. RATINGS RAISED AND REMOVED FROM CREDITWATCH
